column5: Hi,The Lake of the Woods Tourism Association in Northern, Ontario has tons of info on fly-in destinations. You can find us at www.lakeofthewoods.com
I also had a very positive experience with Excellent Adventures. It's a well-run outfitter.
Take a look at Qu√©bec's walleye factory : http://www.reservoir-gouin.com

duanei take it you are after walleyes....check out Northwood Outposts....Drive to Sioux Lookout.... fly into any of 5 lakes with cabins for 4-10 people at reasonable rates....checkout www.intonex.com/northwood....tell the owner Bill that Roger from Stonewall sent you and you may get a discount.......

Take a look at EXCELLENT ADVENTURES, great place to go for a fly-in and good prices. you can e-mail me at [email protected] for some more info
Check out flindtlandingcamp.com, went there last summer and had a great time.

This is a drive to but leave you car and get picked up at the landing. Check out npfishingcamp.com wonderful fishing and have alot of fun too. Catch nice fish, boat 100 walleyes a day and the food is good too.[email protected]<:)))))><
Sorry I gave the wrong web site. it is npfishcamp.com not npfishingcamp.comSharon[email protected]

Duane: you need to be a little more specific in what you are looking for. In my book there are more than one type of fly-ins. Do you want to go to your local airport, fly to winnapeg, get picked up in a 50 setter jet and fly in to a private resrt type fishing lodge, where everything is done for you, guides included, and spend a bizzilon dollars? Or do you want to drive a few hours into canada, and get flowen 45 minutes to a rustic cabin where you provide and cook your own food, etc. but at a cost of $500??? I've been on them all. where are you from? do you want to drive part way, how much do you want to spend?? answer a few of these and I can point you in the right direction.
Check out the posts in the archives of this web site. There are plenty of suggestions. Good luck
